title: Celebrate the Season with Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon NorthTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Celebrate the Season with Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon North  
Make the season bright with Five-Diamond luxury this festive season with Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon North, a Sonoran Desert retreat situated in the cooling foothills of Pinnacle Peak.
 
Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale will be decked out with all the holiday trimmings. On select December 2015 dates, guests can enjoy complimentary hot-roasted nuts in an array of festive flavours and steaming apple cider, a family game night under the Sonoran stars, live music and holiday performances.
 
During this special yuletide season, guests will enjoy exclusive holiday rates when celebrating with Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale. Book the Experience More package and receive a USD 100 credit for every two paid consecutive nights with which to further enjoy the festivities.
 
Thanksgiving 
 
Proof, an American Canteen, will be serving up delectable holiday offerings throughout the month of November 2015 to celebrate all things fall. Seasonal local beer on tap will satisfy adults while fall-inspired desserts will tempt the youngsters. On Thanksgiving Day, after a holiday-inspired breakfast buffet including specialty children’s options, Chef Joey Cavaretta will be preparing a festive three-course dinner to include beer and chestnut soup, a choice of traditional turkey or bourbon maple glazed ham with all the fixings, and a decadent caramelised pumpkin pie. Proof will offer its Greatest Hits menu in addition to the holiday specialties. Proof will be open for regular hours of operation on Thanksgiving and will start the holiday dinner offerings at 4:00 pm.
 
Returning this year, Proof will once more be dishing up holiday Pies ‘n’ Sides. This popular holiday promotion allows guests to order all the festive snacks, sweets and side dishes and take them “to-go,” allowing more time to focus on their main dish and spend more time with friends and family and less time over a hot stove. Holiday-inspired side dishes will include Andouille sausage stuffing, marshmallow and pecan sweet potato pudding, crab mac ‘n’ cheese and more. Pastry Chef Lance Whipple will be baking mouth-watering pies and sweets to include bourbon pecan pie, French toast cheesecake and roasted apple lattice Pie. Each pie is delicately prepared in glass Pyrex dishes that can go straight from the restaurant to the dinner table. To place an order, call Food and Beverage Administrator Erika Cooper at 480 513 5029 starting November 1, 2015 or visit Proof in person to receive a check list and place an order. Items are available for pick up November 24 to 26, 2015. Every order requires 48 hours advance notice.
 
Talavera will feature its annual holiday buffet on Thanksgiving. The dual level buffet offers an impressive display of festive foods from a seafood raw bar to cooked-to-order fall harvest exotic mushrooms with garlic confit and truffle butter, a carving station with lavender-infused turkey and slow-roasted prime rib, and an interactive dessert display with braised caramel apple a la mode. The dinner will run from 12:00 noon to 6:00 pm, and the cost is USD 96 per person, and USD 45 for children ages 5-12. The a la carte menu will not be available. Reservations are required.
 
Source:-Four Seasons
